rule.title: Game Rules
rule.content:
ã€Objectiveã€‘

Move your pieces on a 7Ã—7 board and build walls to carve out your own â€˜territoryâ€™ (an enclosed area containing only your pieces). When the game ends, count the squares in each playerâ€™s territory; the player with the most wins.

ã€Equipment & Playersã€‘
 â€¢ Board: 7Ã—7 squares
 â€¢ Players:
   â€¢ 2-player: Red and Blue, each with 4 pieces
   â€¢ 3/4-player: Add Yellow/Light Blue, each color has 2 pieces
 â€¢ Walls: Unlimited, color-coded by player

ã€Game Flowã€‘
Placement Phase
 â€¢ 2-player: Starting positions fixed: Red [1,1],[5,5]; Blue [1,5],[5,1]. The other two are placed alternately: Red, Blue, Blue, Red
 â€¢ 3/4-player: Each player places 2 pieces, in alternating order (e.g. Aâ†’Bâ†’Câ†’Câ†’Bâ†’A)

Action Phase (turn-based)
 1. Choose any of your pieces that can still act
 2. Move 0, 1, or 2 steps:
   â€¢ Each step must be up, down, left, or right
   â€¢ Cannot cross or pass through walls or other pieces
 3. After moving, you must place a wall on an open side of that pieceâ€™s square (even if you moved 0 steps)

ã€Walls & Bordersã€‘
 â€¢ The boardâ€™s outer edge counts as a wall
 â€¢ 2-player: Walls cannot be removed once placed
 â€¢ 3/4-player: Each player gets one â€œwall breakâ€ per game, usable on their turn

ã€Time Limitã€‘
 â€¢ 90 seconds per turn
 â€¢ If time runs out, a wall is placed randomly and the turn ends

ã€End Conditionã€‘
 â€¢ The game ends when all playersâ€™ pieces are in separate territories

ã€Scoringã€‘
 â€¢ Each square in a territory is worth 1 point
 â€¢ If total scores are tied, the player with the largest single territory wins

ã€Victoryã€‘
 â€¢ Highest score wins
 â€¢ If both total and largest territory are tied, itâ€™s a draw

â”€â”€ Enjoy the game!

seo.description: Wall Go â€“ Free online strategy board game inspired by Devilâ€™s Plan. Play solo or with friends, territory scoring, undo/redo, and a modern UI. No signup needed, just play!
